page.title: 11WEST LODGE FARM, BROMSGROVE
page.content: Although most men retire by 65 years of age, Mr Rhodes and his brother continue to work at West Lodge Farm even though they are both in their seventies.The 205 acres are almost all {permanent pasture}for{hay} and grazing 130 Friesian beef {cattle} and 550 {sheep.}Their day starts about 6.00am when they check their {livestock}and milk two cows by hand. This provides enough milk for the calves and for their own use. Their working day finishes about 5.00pm, unless they are busy hay-making or sheep-dipping. During busy times they rely on the help of{contractors.}Mr Rhodes owns 3 tractors, a combine, a mowing machine and disc harrow.Very little artificial {fertilizer}and no {weed killers} are used.Strangely, Mr Rhodes does not own a dog but 11 pet cats are useful in controlling rodent numbers.
